1.question_text: Full name of person filling out report (first & last)
help: In the space provided, indicate your first and last name.

2.question_text: Position of person filling out report
help: In the space provided, indicate your position at the licensed location; e.g., President, Manager, Member.

3.question_text: Who is the primary person who authorizes employees to order and purchase alcohol for the business?
help: Please list the first and last name of the individual who can authorize employees to order and purchase alcohol at this licensed location.

4.question_text: Is your license/permit posted where it can be seen by the public?
help: Answer "Yes" if anyone coming in to your establishment can see the TABC license/permit from an area that customers have access to. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if anyone coming in to your establishment cannot see the TABC license/permit.

items: Answer "Yes" if you have the Public Information Sign posted in an area that customers have access to and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if you do not have the Public Information Sign posted.

Answer "Yes" if you have the Consumption Warning Sign posted on the outside of your business and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if you do not have the Consumption Warning Sign posted.

*Blue Sign*: This sign gives notice that it is unlawful to carry a weapon on the premises unless the person is licensed to carry the handgun. It is issued to off-premises licenses/permits and on-premises licenses/permits that derive less than 51% of gross income from alcohol sales OR hold a Food & Beverage Certificate.
*Red Sign*: This sign gives notice that it is unlawful to carry a weapon on the premises. It is issued to on-premises accounts that derive more than 51% of gross income from alcohol sales.

Answer "Blue," "Red," or "Both" if you have the Blue, Red, or both Blue and Red Weapons Sign(s) posted on the outside of your premises and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "None" if you do not have any of the Weapons Signs posted.

8.question_text: Fetal Alcohol Sign Posted in Men's & Women's Restrooms
help: Answer "Yes" if you have the Fetal Alcohol Sign posted in both the Men’s and Women’s restrooms and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if you do not have the Fetal Alcohol Sign posted.
Answer "Yes" if you have the Human Trafficking Sign posted and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if you do not have the Human Trafficking Sign posted.

Answer "Yes" if you have the "21" To Enter Sign posted on the outside of your premises and take a photograph of it with your phone when you are prompted to do so. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if you do not have the "21" To Enter Sign posted.

11A.question_text: Do you have alcohol advertising on the outside of the business?
help: Are there any prices or brands of alcohol that can be seen from outside the business?
* Answer "Yes" if you can see any prices, brands, or alcohol advertisements from outside of the business. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
* Answer "No" if you cannot see any prices, brands, or alcohol advertisements from outside of the business.

11B.question_text: Does your business have a "Happy Hour"?
help: Does the location have "Happy Hour" specials? E.g., if the location has a drink special such as $3 well drinks from 2pm-5pm, then the answer would be "Yes".
* Answer "Yes" if this location does have "Happy Hour" specials.
* Answer "No" if this location does not have "Happy Hour" specials.

11C.question_text: Does your business run drink specials past 11:00 PM?
help: Does the location have any drink specials that go past 11pm? E.g., if the location has a drink special such as $3 well drinks from 7pm until 1am, then the answer would be "Yes".
* Answer "Yes" if this location has a drink special past 11pm.
* Answer "No" if this location does not have a drink special past 11pm.

11D.question_text: Does your business run these drink specials from open to close?
help: Answer "Yes" if the location has drink specials from open to close; e.g., drink specials from 10am to 2am or drink specials all day from open until close.
* Answer "Yes" if this location has drink specials from open to close.
* Answer "No" if this location does not have drink specials from open to close.

12.question_text: Choose the vendors that you purchase beer from.
12.label: License/Permit Type:
help: Select and enter the license/permit number(s) for the vendor(s) that the location uses to purchase beer.
You can find your vendor’s license/permit number on the invoices provided during delivery of the alcoholic beverages.
If you do not know, select "Unknown."

13.question_text: Choose the vendors that you purchase wine from.
13.label: License/Permit Type:
help: Select and enter the license/permit number(s) for the vendor(s) that the location uses to purchase wine.
You can find your vendor’s license/permit number on the invoices provided during delivery of the alcoholic beverages.
If you do not know, select "Unknown."

14.question_text: Choose the vendors that you purchase wine from.
14.label: License/Permit Type:
help: Select and enter the license/permit number(s) for vendor(s) that the location uses to purchase wine.
You can find your vendor’s license/permit number on the invoices provided during delivery of the alcoholic beverages.
If you do not know, select "Unknown."

15.question_text: Choose the vendors that you purchase distilled spirits from.
15.label: License/Permit Type:
help: Select and enter the license/permit number(s) for the vendor(s) that the location uses to purchase distilled spirits.
You can find your vendor’s license/permit number on the invoices provided during delivery of the alcoholic beverages.
If you do not know, select "Unknown."

16.question_text: Choose the vendors that you purchase distilled spirits from.
16.label: License/Permit Type:
help: Select and enter the license/permit number(s) for the vendor(s) that the location uses to purchase distilled spirits.
You can find your vendor’s license/permit number on the invoices provided during delivery of the alcoholic beverages.
If you do not know, select "Unknown."

17A.question_text: Are you holding any alcohol product that is damaged?
help: Answer "Yes" if the location has any alcohol product that is damaged.
Answer "No" if the location does not have any damaged alcohol product.

17B.question_text: What product are you holding and why?
help: Type in the text box the alcohol product that is damaged and why the location is holding on to it.

18A.question_text: Is seller training required for all employees that sell/serve alcohol?
help: Answer "Yes" if the location requires all employees who sell/serve alcohol to obtain a certificate from a TABC-approved Seller Server Training School.
Answer "No" if Seller Server Training is not required.

18B.question_text: If seller training is required for employees, do you have written alcohol service policies? If "Yes," then provide pictures of first and last pages.
help: Answer "Yes" if the location has written policies on alcohol service. Provide pictures of the first and last pages of the policy. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if there are not any written policies on alcohol service.

19.question_text: Do you conduct product tastings at the location?
help: Answer "Yes" if product tastings occur at the licensed location. An example of this would be allowing a specific alcohol company to come on to the premises and offer free tasting of their alcohol to your customers.
Answer "No" if product tastings do not occur at the location.

20.question_text: Are TABC Stamps on ALL distilled spirit bottles?
help: Answer "Yes" if TABC Stamps are on all bottles of distilled spirits at the location.
Answer "No" if TABC Stamps are not on all bottles of distilled spirits.

21.question_text: Do you mutilate the TABC Stamp on the bottle when it's empty?
help: Answer "Yes" if the TABC Stamps on all bottles of distilled spirits are mutilated when the bottle is empty. E.g., you would answer "Yes" if a line was scratched through the tax stamps on all bottles of empty distilled spirits.
Answer "No" if the stamps are not mutilated.

22.question_text: Do you maintain food service at the location?
help: Answer "Yes" if there is service of food available at the location.
Answer "No" if there is no service of food available at the location.

23.question_text: Is there a permanent food service facility (kitchen) at the location?
help: Answer "Yes" if the food service facility (kitchen) is permanently at the location.
Answer "No" if the food service facility (kitchen) is not permanently at the location. For example, you would answer "No" if you call in pizza as your only option for food service.

24A.question_text: Is the designated food service area at the location run by a separate business entity from the permit?
help: Answer "Yes" if you have food service at the location that is run and operated by a different business entity from what is on the license/permit. For example, a concession stand that is owned by a different business than the one that owns the alcohol license/permit.
Answer "No" if the business entity that owns the alcohol license/permit also operates the food service.

24B.question_text: Does the separate business entity maintain food service records?
help: Answer "Yes" if the separate business entity maintains records of the food service.
Answer "No" if the business that owns the alcohol license/permit also maintains the food service records.

25.question_text: Do you have multiple entrées per meal period?
help: Answer "Yes" if there are multiple entrées available during each meal serving period.
Answer "No" if there is only a single entrée available during each meal serving period.

26.question_text: Are food items completely prepared or assembled on the premises?
help: Answer "Yes" if the food items are completely prepared or assembled on the premises. This would mean the food was not prepackaged and involves being put together.
Answer "No" if the food is completely prepared or assembled before it is brought onto the premises.

27.question_text: Is prepared food to be consumed primarily on the premises?
help: Answer "Yes" if the prepared food is primarily to be consumed on the premises.
Answer "No" if the prepared food is not primarily consumed on the premises; e.g., pizza taken to go.
Answer "Yes" if the location sells prepackaged food items.
Answer "No" if the location does not sell prepackaged food items.

28B.question_text: Are prepackaged food items from a non-commercial source?
help: Answer "Yes" if the prepackaged food items come from a non-commercial source.
Answer "No" if the prepackaged food items do not come from a non-commercial source.

29A.question_text: Are hours of operation for food and alcohol service the same?
help: Answer "Yes" if the location sells food and alcohol at the same time and does not sell one of them for a longer period of time than the other.
Answer "No" if food is sold at different times than alcohol.

29B.question_text: Which service operates the longer hours, the kitchen or the bar?
help: Answer "Kitchen" if the kitchen is open for food service longer than the bar is open for drink service.
Answer "Bar" if the bar is open longer for drink service than the kitchen is open for food service.

30.question_text: What are your hours of operation for alcohol service on Friday?
help: Enter the beginning time when the location starts alcohol service and enter the end time when alcohol service is no longer available.
Enter "am" or "pm" depending if it is morning or night; e.g., 2pm – 1am.

31.question_text: What are your hours of operation for alcohol service on Saturday?
help: Enter the beginning time when the location starts alcohol service and enter the end time when alcohol service is no longer available.
Enter "am" or "pm" depending if it is morning or night; e.g., 2pm – 1am.

32A.question_text: Have you had a Breach of the Peace at your establishment in the last 12-month period?
help: A Breach of the Peace is defined as:
1. Law enforcement or emergency medical services personnel respond to the premises of a license/permit; or
2. A disturbance is created on the premises by a person who does **any of the following:**
* Causes bodily injury to another person;
* Threatens another person with a weapon;
* Discharges a firearm on the premises of the license/permit; or
* Destroys the licensee’s or permittee’s property, if the incident is reported by the licensee or permittee to a law enforcement agency.

**An incident described in paragraphs (1) and (2) in this section only has to be reported if it:** Occurs at a time when the licensee or permittee, or any person allowed by the licensee or permittee, is on the premises and Interferes with, interrupts, or intrudes upon the operation or management of the licensed premises.
Answer "Yes" if there was an incident at the location in the last 12-month period that meets any of the above requirements.
Answer "No" if no incident has occurred in the last 12-month period.

32B.question_text: Who did you report the Breaches of the Peace to?
help: Answer "Local Law Enforcement" if only the Local Police Department or Sheriff’s Office were notified of any breach of the peace incidents that occurred over the last 12 months.
Answer "TABC" if only TABC was notified of any breach of the peace incidents that occurred over the last 12 months.
Answer "Neither" if no one notified TABC or Local Law Enforcement of the breach of the peace that occurred over the last 12 months.
Answer "Both" if both TABC and Local Law Enforcement were notified of any breach of the peace incidents that occurred over the last 12 months.

32C.question_text: What date did the Breach of Peace occur? Describe the incident.
help: In 500 characters or less, list the date each breach of the peace incident occurred and a brief description.

33.question_text: Has there been a change of trade name, ownership, or in business location since your original or renewal applications were last filed?
help: Answer "Yes" if one of the following has occurred and TABC has not been notified:
* Change in trade name,
* Change in ownership or persons who are in control of the license/permit, or
* Change in business location.
Answer "No" if you have notified TABC of any change in trade name, change in ownership, or change in business location, or you have not had any changes to your ownership.

34.question_text: What is the minimum age that you employ a person to sell/serve alcohol at your location?
help: Answer "16 years old" if the minimum age that you have a person employed to sell/serve alcohol is 16 years old.
Answer "Younger than 16 years old" if the minimum age that you have a person employed to sell/serve alcohol is younger than 16 years old.
Answer "18 years old" if the minimum age that you have a person employed to sell/serve alcohol is 18 years old.
Answer "21 years old" if the minimum age that you have a person employed to sell/serve alcohol is 21 years old.

35.question_text: Is there a rear or side entrance which opens onto a street, parking lot, public sidewalk, or the common area of a mall or shopping center?
help: Answer "Yes" if your business location has a rear or side entrance which opens onto a street, parking lot, public sidewalk, or the common area of a mall or shopping center. Provide a picture of the rear or side entrance. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if your business location does not have a rear or side entrance which opens onto a street, parking lot, public sidewalk, or the common area of a mall or shopping center.

36.question_text: Is there a bathroom that complies with Title III of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990?
help: Answer "Yes" if your business location has a bathroom that complies with Title III of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Tap "Take Picture" to provide one to three pictures.
Answer "No" if your business location does not have a bathroom that complies with Title III of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.
